revised_title: Investigation of Inelastic Collisions Between Atoms and Electrons
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the excitation function of helium by measuring the intensities of spectral lines emitted by atoms after collision with electrons. They found that the probability of excitation to a given state is dependent on the velocity of the exciting electrons. The results showed a general agreement with previous findings, but also revealed some deviations due to more complex excitation processes.
